skillObjects.name: Frontend
skillObjects.description: I think frontend is fun and I enjoy the visual element of it. I have gained a lot of experience with frontend through school projects, personal projects and internships. HOWEVER, frontend is not a field that I aim to become an expert in. I just consider it a powerfull tool to visualize ideas or create a good customer experience.

skillObjects.name: Backend
skillObjects.description: I do wish I had more experience with different backend technologies. My go-to is making REST APIs with Expres (node.js) using either a MongoDB or an SQL database. It must be mentioned that my line of study puts a huge emphasis on the theory behind database systems, datawarehouses and cloud technologies.

skillObjects.name: Data analysis
skillObjects.description: By "data analysis" I am referring to the entire process of extracting useful insights from data, of which I am quite familiar with; data extraction, data preprocessing, data processing (model training), evaluation and hyperparameter tuning. This I've learned from school projects and online courses. Below I have also included keywords regarding big data, as I have some experience with it from university.

links.name: Certificate - Build Deep Learning Models with TensorFlow

skillObjects.name: NLP
skillObjects.description: I found a passion for NLP during a class I had in the fourth year of my computer science degree, which ultimately led to me writing a master thesis on this subject. The topic for the thesis is "computational linguistic creativity", and I am currently in the midst of narrowing it down to a more specific task. I will update this section as I progress.
